item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, February 26, 2025 at 10:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Telescope – an open-source web-based log viewer for logs stored in ClickHouse (36 points | 16 comments)
2. DeepGEMM: clean and efficient FP8 GEMM kernels with fine-grained scaling (309 points | 59 comments)
3. I Went to SQL Injection Court (879 points | 347 comments)
4. Iterated Log Coding (41 points | 12 comments)
5. Page is under construction: A love letter to the personal website (75 points | 24 comments)
6. Hyperspace (695 points | 364 comments)
7. Part two of Grant Sanderson's video with Terry Tao on the cosmic distance ladder (284 points | 42 comments)
8. Material Theme has been pulled from VS Code's marketplace (168 points | 129 comments)
9. Terence Tao – Machine-Assisted Proofs [video] (73 points | 6 comments)
10. Launch HN: Browser Use (YC W25) – open-source web agents (179 points | 74 comments)
11. Ggwave: Tiny Data-over-Sound Library (186 points | 46 comments)
12. Gustatory Wisdom: Bruegel the Elder's Twelve Proverbs (1558) (9 points | 1 comment)
13. Understanding Surrogate Pairs: Why Some Windows Filenames Can't Be Read (38 points | 12 comments)
14. Hard problems that reduce to document ranking (254 points | 31 comments)
15. The journalists training AI models for Meta and OpenAI (5 points | 1 comment)
16. Bald eagles are thriving again after near extinction (222 points | 141 comments)
17. Evaluating modular RAG with reasoning models (37 points | 6 comments)
18. The XB-70 (2019) (169 points | 96 comments)
19. A CLI to quickly launch VSCode/cursor devcontainers (4 points | discuss)
20. The Deep Research problem (203 points | 79 comments)
21. Why are QR Codes with capital letters smaller than QR codes with lower case? (219 points | 48 comments)
22. Emergent Misalignment: Narrow finetuning can produce broadly misaligned LLMs [pdf] (124 points | 77 comments)
23. Embedding Python in Elixir, it's fine (277 points | 59 comments)
24. Modernist Cuisine: The Art and Science of Cooking (79 points | 55 comments)
25. Chicory: A JVM native WebAssembly runtime (176 points | 67 comments)
26. If it is worth keeping, save it in Markdown (239 points | 168 comments)
27. Voker (YC S24) is hiring an LA-based full stack AI software engineer ( | hide)
28. Show HN: MyCoder, an open source Claude-Code alternative (74 points | 14 comments)
29. New maps of the chaotic space-time inside black holes (122 points | 71 comments)
30. Tristan Davey's Punch Card Archive (13 points | 3 comments)
